full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 14 of 228 690 LC2Qmax1 Kane - Direct information contained in handwritten form -- 1 MR. ROHRBACH: May I? 2 THE COURT: You may. 3 MR. ROHRBACH: Thank you. 4 BY MR. ROHRBACH: 5 Q. Mr. Kane, when an application is received by a Professional Children's School, what happens? 6 A. As I mentioned, the admissions director would review the information, contact the family, would bring them into the school if it looks to be a good fit for the school and would begin to interview them. So the family is first contacted by phone, and then the family would be brought in to tour the school and to have a conversation with the admissions director. 13 Q. Does the Professional Children's School rely on the information in these records when it makes its admissions decision? 14 A. Yes, they do. 15 Q. Does the Professional Children's School make admission decisions in the ordinary course of its business? 16 A. Yes. 17 Q. And after the Professional Children's School makes admission decisions, does it retain the applications? 18 A. Yes. 19 MR. ROHRBACH: Your Honor, based on that record, the government offers again this exhibit. 20 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017887

text_blocks.content: MR. ROHRBACH: May I? THE COURT: You may. MR. ROHRBACH: Thank you. BY MR. ROHRBACH: Q. Mr. Kane, when an application is received by a Professional Children's School, what happens? A. As I mentioned, the admissions director would review the information, contact the family, would bring them into the school if it looks to be a good fit for the school and would begin to interview them. So the family is first contacted by phone, and then the family would be brought in to tour the school and to have a conversation with the admissions director. Q. Does the Professional Children's School rely on the information in these records when it makes its admissions decision? A. Yes, they do. Q. Does the Professional Children's School make admission decisions in the ordinary course of its business? A. Yes. Q. And after the Professional Children's School makes admission decisions, does it retain the applications? A. Yes. MR. ROHRBACH: Your Honor, based on that record, the government offers again this exhibit.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and readable format. There are no visible redactions or damage.
